Node.definition: = a marker indicating that an important statement is following and demanding the attention of the listener

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= causative action by which humans or deities create an object, ◄ described as an artisan shaping clay into an artifact
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects
= action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans ► in order to make their life, work, task or situation easier

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel
= another name for Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) used in poetry
= action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events
= causative action by which humans cause a liquid to flow from one place to another
= state in which land is extremely dry and in need of water, ◄ as if it were thirsty
= earth not covered by water
= causative action by which humans cause a liquid to flow from one place to another

= an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)
= a person’s child or children, or the young of an animal
= action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, and events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same
= one's children including their respective offspring ◄ literally referred to as those who come forth from someone

Node.gloss: to sprout|to come up|to spring up
Node.definition: = process by which plants, trees, or hairs come up and start growing; ≈ sometimes extended to denote the coming in existence of people, conditions, or activities
= the area separating two or mores locations
= type of grass; ◄ plants; ► serves as food for animals; ≈ regarded as weak, vulnerable, and short lived
= course of impetuously flowing water; ≈ probably evokes the image of seasonal streams fed by rain, assuring agricultural growth, a sign of God's blessing

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel
= action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= action by which humans adopt a name or title for themselves

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

= causative action by which humans or deity deliver an individual or group of people from the power of someone else or from difficult circumstances, ► which usually implies that the one who performed the act of deliverance has the right to claim the ones he delivered for himself
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= pertaining to being the latest in a chronological range of events, which may be situated in either past, present, or future
= particle indicating that a certain state is not true or that an event does not take place without the involvement of someone else

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities make a public announcement
= causative action by which deities call objects to existence
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
literally: to come; hence: = process by which things happen to someone ◄ as if it were a person coming to visit
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= state in which humans experience fear
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= referent pointing to a period or point of time in the distant past
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse
= action by which humans provide evidence or proof that something has taken place or that some decision has been made
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= particle indicating that a certain state is not true or that an event does not take place without the involvement of someone else

Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
figurative extension of a rock as place of refuge: = deity that protects and provides refuge
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= causative action by which humans or deities create an object, ◄ described as an artisan shaping clay into an artifact
= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ carved out of wood and sometimes stone, ► and functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship
= something that has no value and hence does not profit anyone
= process by which humans or deities experience an eager desire for a person or object
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= causative process by which certain objects or activities promote someone's well being
= action by which humans provide evidence or proof that something has taken place or that some decision has been made
= particle marking a proposition as not true

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

Node.gloss: to be ashamed|to come to shame|to be put to shame|to be disappointed

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= causative action by which humans or deities create an object, ◄ described as an artisan shaping clay into an artifact
= generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ carved out of wood and sometimes stone, ► and functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship

literally: to pour out; hence: = causative action by which humans pour molten metal into a mold ► to create a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing to be used as an object of non sanctioned worship
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= causative process by which certain objects or activities promote someone's well being
= person that belongs to a group or class of people

Node.gloss: to be ashamed|to come to shame|to be put to shame|to be disappointed
Node.definition: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status
= person with the skill to produce an artifact out of rough materials, such as stone, wood, metal
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

Node.gloss: to come together|to gather|to assemble|to rally|to (re)unite
Node.definition: = action by which humans or animals come together as a group for a common purpose

Node.gloss: to be ashamed|to come to shame|to be put to shame|to be disappointed
Node.definition: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status
= state in which multiple events are connected
= person with the skill to produce an artifact out of rough materials, such as stone, wood, metal
= a strong, hard magnetic silvery grey metal, ► used in construction and manufacturing; ≈ associated with strength and permanence
exact meaning unsure: = tool ► used by a blacksmith to shape iron
= action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen

= instrument of about 30 centimeters long, consisting of a handle, usually made of wood, to which was attached a stone, wooden, or (less frequently) metal head; ► used for many purposes, including the breaking or dressing of building stones, pounding nails or pegs into wood, or pounding pegs into the ground; also used by blacksmiths to shape hot metal
= causative action by which humans or deities create an object, ◄ described as an artisan shaping clay into an artifact
= action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen
= each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈ directly associated with strength and power
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= to be in a state of wanting or needing food, but having little to no access to food

Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

= person with the skill to produce an artifact out of rough materials, such as stone, wood, metal
= a single piece of wood taken from a tree, cut and finished, and used for building and construction

Node.gloss: to stretch out a measuring line
Node.definition: literally: to stretch out a measuring line (over something); hence: = action by which humans or deities determine the measurements of an area as part of a construction or demolition job
= line ► used for measuring the size of an object; ≈ sometimes used in a figurative sense in the context of moral and ethical standards
= causative action by which someone uses a tool, such as a stylus (שֶׂרֶד) or a compass (מְחוּגָה) to draw a curved line
exact meaning unsure; = either a tool with a sharp point or a type of red chalk; ► used to make marks on wood to help the carpenter plan out the shape of the object he wants to make
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= metal tool with a sharp edge ► used to shape wood
= tool; ► for drawing, marking circles, or making measurements
= causative action by which someone uses a tool, such as a stylus (שֶׂרֶד) or a compass (מְחוּגָה) to draw a curved line
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= causative action by which humans use a knife or another sharp implement to remove something from a larger object

= evergreen tree growing up to 40 m tall, with a trunk up to 2.5 m in diameter; as it grows older its branches spread out more and more horizontally; grows in elevated places; ◄ Cedrus libani; ► highly appreciated building material; also used in cleaning ritual; ≈ associated with beauty, quality, pride, and strength

= a type of tree which reaches a height of up to 10 m; often shaped like an umbrella, which gives it the nickname “umbrella pine”; ◄ Pinus pinea; ► it is the only pine in the region to produce edible seeds; its wood is suitable for carving

= a large size tree found either alone or in clumps or forests; ◄ one of the varieties of |iQuercus|i*; ► functioned as landmarks, grave marks or gathering places; since its groves were considered sacred by Canaanites, ritual practices under them was always a temptation to Israelites, denounced in the texts as idolatry; ≈ their characteristics made them suitable symbols of a variety of attributes or attitudes

Node.gloss: to strengthen|to support|to repair|to let grow strong
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause inanimate objects or (other) humans to have physical, political, and/or military strength
= any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit
= a large group of trees or shrubs which grow close together and where several wild animals are known to live; ≈ considered to be a dangerous place for humans and domestic animals

= action of placing a seed or small plant in the ground so that it will grow and produce ≈ used symbolically to describe God's act of giving the people of Israel their own land, as promised to their ancestors
exact meaning unknown: = tree ► of which the wood can be used for wood carving
= water that has fallen as rain

Node.gloss: to make grow|to bring up|to rear|to educate|to tend
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans take care of young plants or young humans while they undergo the natural development of increasing in size and changing physically on their way to being fully grown
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= action by which someone causes something else to be harmed or destroyed by fire

Node.gloss: to be warm|to be hot|to become warm|to become hot
Node.definition: = process by which human or inanimate objects feel or become warm or hot

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it
= causative action by which humans prepare food with dry heat without direct exposure to a flame, typically in an oven (תַּנּוּר)
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it
= action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen
= generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= action by which humans lay themselves down on the ground in front of another human or a deity, ► as an act of submission or respect

= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ carved out of wood and sometimes stone, ► and functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship

= one part of an object or substance that has been divided into two parts

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= one part of an object or substance that has been divided into two parts
= the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

= state in which food has been prepared for consumption by exposing it to the heat of an open fire
= process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it

Node.definition: = process by which human or inanimate objects feel or become warm or hot

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation
= generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= action or process by which the functioning of something is prevented or stopped

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

Node.gloss: to be wise|to have understanding|to be skilled
Node.definition: = state in which humans have the ability to understand things
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

Node.gloss: to take to heart|to keep in mind|to call to mind
Node.definition: literally: to bring (a matter) back to (one's) heart; hence: = action by which humans store information in their minds and continue to reflect on it
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= one part of an object or substance that has been divided into two parts

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it
= causative action by which humans prepare food with dry heat without direct exposure to a flame, typically in an oven (תַּנּוּר)
= carbonized material resulting from heating wood, ► and used for cooking or warming
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= causative process by which humans prepare food for consumption by exposing it to the heat of an open fire
= the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= what remains in existence after part of the original quantity has disappeared or has been used or dealt with in a certain way; used for humans, animals, plants, and inanimate objects

= a reference to the physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing, ► functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship, ≈ with a very strong added connotation of something utterly detestable
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
exact meaning discussed; = a portion of some part of nature, which is understood as having produced it; the final shape is instrumental for people and animals in some contexts
= a single piece of wood taken from a tree, cut and finished, and used for building and construction
= action by which humans lay themselves down on the ground in front of another human or a deity, ► as an act of submission or respect

literally: to graze; hence: = action by which humans are
actively looking for a certain activity to engage in, ◄ as an animal is looking for food

= powdery residue left after the burning of a substance; normally deposited outside of a village or city; ► used by mourners to put on their heads or roll themselves into; ≈ associated with things that are fine and powdery and easily scattered by the wind, with low status, and possibly with mortality as well
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= action by which humans act dishonestly towards others

Node.gloss: to cause (others) to turn (from the right way)
Node.definition: literally: to cause (someone) to turn aside (from the right way); hence: = causative action by which humans cause (other) humans to deviate from what is considered to be the right way to conduct their lives
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= state in which objects or activities do not serve a valid purpose and can only lead to disappointment
= the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= causative action by which humans or deities create an object, ◄ described as an artisan shaping clay into an artifact

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= action when one is no longer able to remember or recall a person or a past experience
= causative action by which deities decide to no longer hold a certain human's behavior against that person, as if by erasing that sin from one's record
= mass of visible, condensed watery vapor floating in the air; ► producing rain; ≈ God is said to envelop himself with clouds
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
= a visible collection of condensed water vapor hanging in the atmosphere, often high above the ground ≈ also used to represent God's presence and activity
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
literally: to turn (to someone); hence: = action by which humans or deities associate with other humans or deities, often to look for or to provide help and support

= causative action by which humans or deity deliver an individual or group of people from the power of someone else or from difficult circumstances, ► which usually implies that the one who performed the act of deliverance has the right to claim the ones he delivered for himself
a more or less fixed phrase: the heavens and the earth, equivalent to a single lexical item: the totality of God's creation

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= a large group of trees or shrubs which grow close together and where several wild animals are known to live; ≈ considered to be a dangerous place for humans and domestic animals
= any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

= causative action by which humans or deity deliver an individual or group of people from the power of someone else or from difficult circumstances, ► which usually implies that the one who performed the act of deliverance has the right to claim the ones he delivered for himself
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= state in which humans or deities are considered worthy of honor and respect more than others

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= causative action by which humans or deity deliver an individual or group of people from the power of someone else or from difficult circumstances, ► which usually implies that the one who performed the act of deliverance has the right to claim the ones he delivered for himself
= causative action by which humans or deities create an object, ◄ described as an artisan shaping clay into an artifact
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
literally: to stretch out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities causes an area to be covered with something with the shape and the flexibility of a large piece of cloth
a more or less fixed phrase: the heavens and the earth, equivalent to a single lexical item: the totality of God's creation
= state of being integrated but physically detached from other, similar objects or events
= causative action by which a deity creates the firmament to cover the earth as a vault, ◄ described as a craftsman who hammers out a piece of metal into a flat surface

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= object or event that reminds of something that has happened or as a confirmation of something that is yet to happen
= person who speaks on behalf of a deity or other supernatural power; ≈ probably associated with foolishness

= action by which humans communicate with the spirit world using a variety of means such as inspecting the liver of animals, shaking arrows, consulting teraphim, or casting lots; ≈ usually regarded as an evil practice that is to be condemned; responsibility of a prophet or king
= causative action by which deities or humans cause (other) humans to either become fools or look like fools
literally: to cause (someone else) to turn (from an activity); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or deities to stop being engaged in a certain activity
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

= pertaining to a movement in a direction away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was facing the East, the term is also often used to denote the West; also associated with failure, unfaithfulness, and outright rebellion
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly

Node.gloss: to make foolish|to turn into foolishness
Node.definition: = causative action by which human behavior is made or becomes unwise or senseless|read סכל (סכל)

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= state in which a place or area has been made the home of humans

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one
= state in which a land, building, or town has been totally destroyed, ► to the extent that nobody can live there anymore

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= process by which a body of water or place that was formerly covered with moisture dries up, ◄ as a result of evaporation or draining; ► in the case of land, if this condition persists, sedentary life will become impossible
= flowing body of water
= process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence are caused to lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= man; ► king of Persia (פָּרַס) who allowed the exiles from Judah (יְהוּדָה) to return
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one
= a building or set of buildings, distinguished from other constructions or houses by its magnificence ► and function, which is either religious or political
= causative action by which humans put in place the bottom part of a building or larger structure, usually below the ground level, which will have to bear the entire construction
